page.title: 02Watford: An introduction
page.content: From its single High St. leading to {St.Marys church}in medieval times Watford has grown to a large modern town with leisure centre, hypermarket, shopping precinct,plus the green belt of{Whippendell Woods and Cassiobury} {Park.}Singer Elton John is chairman of {Watford Football Club}- The Hornets. The town is centrally placed for road, rail and canal links. Its early success in{printing}and paper making made it an industrial centre.Now microtechnology has led to a decline in old typesetting skills. Many jobs have been lost.Odhams Press has closed. The new{Watford Business {Park}is a sign of confidence in the town's future. The{population}is 74000 with a number of ethnic minorities - hence the new {mosque.}Watford is 'twinned' with Mainz, Nanterre and Novgorod.
